channel.title: RS2007 [XTEA Dumper] - XTEA Collection - Help out!
channel.description:
So after seeing King Dan. (from r-s) release a dumper client, I decided to do the same thing but do it as a web-based collection.
Description: The client will grab the xteas and save them in your xtea folder, then it will upload the keys to the database and is available for download on the web site. Keys that are already there will not be uploaded but will be in your personal xtea folder. I'm just trying to get everyone to chip in for collecting this while it's available.
Link: [url=http://trapd.org]RS2007 XTEA Collection - By The Users For The Users.[/url]
Do I need to do anything to use this client? -Nope, just download it and run it.
Well how do I download the xteas? -You just click the download navigation and click generate download. It will generate and zip all the keys dumped by all the users and zip it for you to download.
Well how do I know this is safe? -I provide a .jar download and an open source download. Feel free to look through either of them.
Well I want to see exactly what the client is doing. -That's fine with me, download the open source version (or the jarred and decompile) and look in Class99.java it's doing exactly as I described.
Is my account at risk for using this? -Well of course it is. You're using a modified (third party) client. Which could possibly get you banned. I highly doubt it, though.
Pictures of the site: [img]http://gyazo.com/d373b43669438231ffbab50cc9997f3d.png[/img] [img]http://gyazo.com/45190867734f62b0306478fe57a2a44d.png[/img] [img]http://gyazo.com/eb48362196581b8dd0fc9cc33ea6ac08.png[/img]
If you have any concerns, questions, or suggestions feel free to pm me.

item.title: RS2007 [XTEA Dumper] - XTEA Collection - Help out!
item.dc:creator: @Jaded Jaded
item.description:
@Jaded wrote:

Like ^ said, what exactly is this?

I believe it would be good that you explain what XTEA is for those who aren’t familiar with it. But I suppose it looks interessting

Read full topic
